WaveSoundBuffer.getVisBuffer

Function/Meaning
Get visualization data
Type
Method of WaveSoundBuffer class
Syntax
getVisBuffer(buffer, numsamples, channel, ahead=0)
Arguments
buffer Specifies the buffer to write the output data to.
The buffer must be an array of 16-bit signed integers, with a size sufficient to hold the samples specified by the numsamples and channel arguments (at least numsamples * channel).
If a value other than 1 is specified for channel, the samples for each channel are stored interleaved (e.g., Right Left Right Left ... for stereo).
A pointer to the first element of the array must be specified, but it should be passed cast to an integer type.
numsamples Specifies the number of samples to retrieve.
channel Specifies the number of channels to retrieve.
If 1 is specified, you will get the data as-is for mono, or downmixed to 1 channel otherwise.
If a value other than 1 is specified, it must match the number of channels in the sound being played. In this case, the data is retrieved as-is.
ahead Specifies the number of samples to read ahead.
Data can be retrieved starting from the sample that is the specified number of samples ahead of the current playback position.
If 0 is specified or this argument is omitted, retrieval starts from the current playback position.
Return Value
Returns the number of samples successfully retrieved.
Description
Retrieves PCM data for visualization.
Reads PCM data from the current playback position and writes it to the array specified by the buffer argument.
However, depending on the buffer state or playback format, it may not be possible to read the data correctly.
This method is intended to be used from plugins written in C, C++, etc. Therefore, for example, you cannot specify a TJS array for the buffer argument.
To use this method, the WaveSoundBuffer.useVisBuffer property must be set to true.
